page.title: 17Education in Bridport.
page.content: St. Mary's Voluntary Controlled Primary School is the largest primary school in West Dorset. It functions from two sites: the Infant Department in Gundry Lane and the Junior School in King Street. The King Street buildings once housed Bridport General School. Today the Bridport Teachers' Centre shares the site. St. Mary's is due to be rehoused within the next two years in a new building at St.Mary's Fields. In Flood Lane is Mountjoy School, a County Mixed Day School for children with severe and complex learning difficulties. The school can accommodate sixty five. Places are offered to Dorset children, those in Cheshire Homes and then to bordering counties.
